description: Digital currencies like Bitcoins have created a different, faster and potentially cheaper way of monetary transfers. The technology behind Bitcoins, namely Blockchain or more broadly the distributed ledger system, has brought big impact on financial services. A blockchain is a distributed database of ownership records (public ledger) of all transactions. A blockchain is irrevocable once it is committed into the system. Through this module, students will learn about blockchain and distributed ledger technologies among others.
title: Blockchain and Distributed Ledger Technologies
prerequisite: (CS2102 or BT2102) and ((CS1020 or its equivalent) or (CS2030 or its equivalent) or CS2103/T or CS2113/T)
